Player History
Drafted in 1st round, 12th overall pick, by Cincinnati in 1965...
Traded from Cincinnati to New York (A) on 7/4/1966 (Going to CIN: CF M. Mantle. Going to NYY: RF V. Pinson, C G. Tenace, 2B L. Boehmer, LF T. Harper)...
Had first career hit on 4/1/1972, off Fred Newman (CAL)...
Hit first career homerun on 4/18/1972, off Moe Drabowsky (BAL)...
Won Player of the Week award on 9/15/1975, hitting .450 with 7 HR, 11 RBI...
Won World Series with New York (A) in 1976...
Hit for the cycle against Boston on 7/28/1978...
Had 5 hits with 2 RBI against Boston on 7/28/1978...
Drove in 6 runs against Minnesota on 5/10/1979...
Was selected to the 1979 Allstar game...
Was selected to the 1980 Allstar game...
Drove in 6 runs against Chicago (A) on 9/22/1980...
Won World Series with New York (A) in 1980...
Signed as a free agent by Chicago (N) on 2/17/1982 to a 2-year deal worth $12,000,000 per year...
Traded from Chicago (N) to New York (A) on 6/16/1983 (Going to CHC: 3B D. Driessen. Going to NYY: C G. Tenace)...
Drafted in 3rd round, 57th overall pick, by Chicago (N) in 1985...
Injured on 5/2/1989 with a Stiff Shoulder, out for 4 days...
Earned first career win on 5/19/1991...
